ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: n/a

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Research skills
helpful research skills for my thesis, we all had a group to workshop with which made the feedback and discussion more manageable
Senior Thesis Course. We covered topics such as developing a research topic, finding sources, starting the writing process, etc.
improving my thesis!
How to do research 101, some of this information was repetitive from what we have learned throughout our time at Yale but it was also extremely helpful
I gained many different research and writing skills for the process of writing my thesis, and received lots of great feedback that helped me work on my project.
I learned various methods and approaches that I could utilize for my thesis

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: When they say ER&M they really mean it for those studying the Americas.
There should be more time built in during the fall semester for students to do their research (rather than just learn how) because 20 pages of writing are expected at the end of the term.

Overall the course would be better in person, but it was definitely helpful to have to reach some milestones on my thesis and fun to talk to Prof. Laguna and other ER&M seniors about the cumulative work we were doing.
our working groups are super helpful to keep each other accountable
Professor Lagunas icebreakers made online learning better. The assignments were also helpful

Strengths: lots of opportunity to work on your project, peer review from classmates

Weaknesses: none!
strength: having workshop groups that we met with almost weekly

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The breakout rooms to discuss and do work were very helpful, and I definitely felt like the guest speakers gave me an idea about what the process should be like,.
more small group discussions like we would have in an in person class would have been nice

All of the course was well adapted for virtual learning. Professor Laguna made himself available very frequently to help us, and putting us in writing groups during the semester helped to provide structure and a sense of community.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Required if you are writing a thesis, but also helpful
Yes!
Yes!
Yes
This course is required if you are writing the yearlong thesis. But yes! Its a great opportunity to work on your thesis in a collaborative environment.
yes, the colloquium is very helpful in planning out and getting started on your thesis
